name: unattributable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something is unattributable, it is impossible to know who said, made, or did it. : As well as being almost unattributable, these remotely-operated cyber attacks offer a low-risk way of conducting espionage. Most of the reports are from unattributable, unnamed sources on one side or another. Compare
unattributed
More examplesFewer examplesEveryone we spoke to in our investigation insisted that their comments must be strictly unattributable.He argues that unattributable quotes create distrust, adding that "journalism which is not believed has failed".The Copyright Act still offers no protection to works such as cave paintings, which are unattributable to individual artists.
